questions.question: A set of steps to solve a problem or perform a calculation is also known as ___.

John has to sort a list of numbers. He writes code to loop over the list, comparing two numbers at a time, and swapping them if the first is more than the second number. This repeats until the current number is less than the next number, or until it reaches the end of the list. This is an example of ___ sort.

In ___ sort of a list of numbers, a pivot number is selected, then every number less than the pivot is moved to the left, and every number moved to the right in a process of partitioning. This is repeated with by selecting a pivot in each partition until partitions with just one number remain.

___ are sequenced orders of numbers that only allow access to the first element, a scheme known as FIFO (First-in-First-out).
___ are data structures in which each element of the list is sequentially joined to the next element.
___ are hybrid data structures that can be iterated over like arrays, and have key-value pairs like objects.
___ are non-sequential data structures made of parent-child relationships, with internal and external nodes having ancestors and descendents.

questions.question: Unlike arrays, the ArrayList data type ___.
options: cannot hold image or sound data

questions.question: The ___ method can be used to cut an item out of an ArrayList.
When working with HashMaps, the ___ method is used to set a key's value, and the ___ method is used to retrieve the key's value.
In Object Oriented Programming languages like Java, ___ is like a blueprint while ___ is an instantiated version of it.
___ methods can only be used inside a class while ___ methods can be used by anyone.
Classes that inherit from other classes are called ___, and are created using the ___ keyword.
The ability of an object to take on many forms, through using superclasses to instantiate subclasses, is known as ___.
Unlike fields declared as private, those declared as ___ are available to subclasses.
Java has a tool called ___ that allows for only defining what behaviors a subclass should have, without providing any implementation.
PHP cannot be ___.
options: set up to run on a server

questions.question: PHP files always start with ___.
The PHP code for printing out John's name, stored in the variable `$name` is:
___ in PHP can be thought of by analogy as being similar to objects in JavaScript.
In order to work with objects in PHP, we must create ___ first and then ___ them to get objects.
___ properties and methods are available to anyone who creates an object.
Instantiation is done with the ___ keyword.
___ are built-in variables that are available in all scopes.
Laravel is a PHP framework that eases the task of building out:
___ is a dependency manager for PHP projects, similar to NPM for node.
Laravel projects use a ___ design pattern.
In Laravel projects, ___ is simply a way to tell the database that it is being updated with a new model.
___ is templating engine that comes with Laravel.
Laravel determines which controller method to call based on:
options: The HTTP method used to send the request
The URL to which the request data is sent

quiz.title: Python and Django - Multiple Choice Questions

questions.question: In Python, how is a variable `my_var` declared?
Running the following code will print :    ```    def sum(x, y = 2):      return x + y    print(sum(5))    ```
When creating a Class how do you establish context on instantiation?
options: Passing the `this` keyword in the __init__ method
Using the keyword self within the __init__ method
Binding of context is automatic upon instantiation
Passing self as the first argument to the __init__ method

questions.objective: 4)  Regex metacharacter used to declare the end of the line
questions.question: When defining urls in the `urlpatterns` what is the correct syntax to establish the start and end to a route?

questions.objective: 5)  Importance of the runserver command in Django
questions.question: What does running the `python manage.py runserver` command allow us to do?

questions.objective: 6)  Test the reason to use virtualenv when developing in Python
questions.question: When starting a Python project, starting with `virtualenv` allows you to?
options: Create cloud environment for pair programming
Create workspace to install local packages
Allows package manager to install Python packages

questions.objective: 7)  Understanding the possibility of argument lists in functions
questions.question: In the following snippet:    ```    def find_value(*args):      # function code block here    ```

options: args is now a required argument
args is a dictionary of arguments
args is a list of arguments

questions.objective: 8)  Testing the importance of using templates in Django
questions.question: Using templates demonstrates what major benefit in a MVC architecture?
options: Decoupling of logic and template for easier maintenance
Holding helper functions for code reusability

questions.objective: 9)  Using models in an MVC architecture
questions.question: The advantage of using models is that it ___.
options: Allows for holding logic to which the view can react
Makes a formatted object to communicate data with the database
Provides prebuilt views for rendering to the DOM

questions.objective: 10)  Importance of having capture groups for dynamic parameters
questions.question: In the following URL `quiltyascharged.com/quilt/99`, which capture group would grab the quilt id for us?
